roleset.name: fight constantly, fight!, long-standing fighting
roleset.note: FEUD-V NOTES: Frames file for 'feud' based on sentences in wsj. Verbnet entry 36.4-1. (from feud.01-v predicate notes)
FEUD-N NOTES: Roleset based on instances in BOLT DF07. Framed by Claire. (from feud.01-n)
FEUDING-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on BOLT, feud.01. Corresponds to VNcls battle-36.4-1. (from feuding.01-n)

example.name: merged combatants
example.text: Mr. Blair and Hees have been feuding for months.

example.name: separated combatants
example.text: Mr. Tonkin, who *trace* has been feuding with the Big Three since he took office earlier this year, said that with half of the nation's dealers losing money or breaking even, it was time for ``emergency action.''
example.arg: since he took office earlier this year

example.name: with point of contention
example.text: But more recently, the Pentagon and the Commerce Department openly feuded over the extent to which Cocom should liberalize exports of personal computers to the bloc.
example.arg: the Pentagon and the Commerce Department
over the extent to which Cocom should liberalize exports of personal computers to the bloc

example.name: All args
example.text: The debate comes as the BBC's former director-general Greg Dyke renewed his feud with the Government over the David Kelly affair.

example.name: args 0 and 2
example.text: While the hostilities between internal factions of the clerical regime and their feuding over the sham election is escalating , the people of Tehran , particularly young people , demonstrated in their thousands in different parts of the city including Fatemi Street , Vali - Asr Street and Square , Vanak Square , Shariati Street , Takht - e - Tavoos Street and Sa'adatabad against the illegitimate and fraudulent election .
